pullrequest.title: In Windows ignore disabled interfaces in Connection::GetLocalEndpoint()

content.raw:
This modification is necessary to avoid the need of manually set the `GAZEBO_IP` environment variable on some Windows configurations.  
A similar check was already merged in [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3009/adding-check-to-make-sure-automatic/diff](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3009/adding-check-to-make-sure-automatic/diff) for the non-Windows part of the code.   
The same check is also present in ignition-transport in [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/f6f581a6852b0eccc8d9e27c398def9f174ca33a/src/NetUtils.cc#lines-292](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/f6f581a6852b0eccc8d9e27c398def9f174ca33a/src/NetUtils.cc#lines-292) .

This fix has been merged by @{5bee878f5416561374c46bd9} in the Gazebo build for ROSOnWindows in [https://bitbucket.org/seanyen-msft/gazebo/commits/c7e4cd2f0fbb471066b752b2dbc6ee2366fab527](https://bitbucket.org/seanyen-msft/gazebo/commits/c7e4cd2f0fbb471066b752b2dbc6ee2366fab527), and I can confirm that it is working, see [https://github.com/ms-iot/ROSOnWindows/issues/47](https://github.com/ms-iot/ROSOnWindows/issues/47) for a complete discussion on this.
content.html:
This modification is necessary to avoid the need of manually set the GAZEBO_IP environment variable on some Windows configurations.
A similar check was already merged in #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3009/adding-check-to-make-sure-automatic/diff for the non-Windows part of the code.
The same check is also present in ignition-transport in https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/f6f581a6852b0eccc8d9e27c398def9f174ca33a/src/NetUtils.cc#lines-292 .

This fix has been merged by @Sean Yen in the Gazebo build for ROSOnWindows in https://bitbucket.org/seanyen-msft/gazebo/commits/c7e4cd2f0fbb471066b752b2dbc6ee2366fab527, and I can confirm that it is working, see https://github.com/ms-iot/ROSOnWindows/issues/47 for a complete discussion on this.

pullrequest.title: In Windows ignore disabled interfaces in Connection::GetLocalEndpoint()

content.raw:
If you want CI results to post automatically to pull requests from any of your forks, give write access to @osrf_jenkins

CI results:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=2464)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2464/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2464/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none&build=1042)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/1042/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/1042/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia&build=797)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/797/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/797/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=1677)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1677/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1677/

I didn't see any unexpected failures

If you want CI results to post automatically to pull requests from any of your forks, give write access to @osrf_jenkins

pullrequest.title: In Windows ignore disabled interfaces in Connection::GetLocalEndpoint()

content.raw:
> If you want CI results to post automatically to pull requests from any of your forks, give write access to @osrf\_jenkins

Cool, I was not aware of that. Unfortunately Bitbucket creates a new fork for any PR created from the web interface, but it is not difficult to add write access to @osrf\_jenkins once the new fork has been created.
content.html:
If you want CI results to post automatically to pull requests from any of your forks, give write access to @osrf_jenkins

Cool, I was not aware of that. Unfortunately Bitbucket creates a new fork for any PR created from the web interface, but it is not difficult to add write access to @osrf_jenkins once the new fork has been created.

pullrequest.title: In Windows ignore disabled interfaces in Connection::GetLocalEndpoint()

content.raw: as long as you add write access before the CI jobs have completed, it should post the build status. it can be tricky to add it before the jobs have started but it takes a while for the jobs to finish, so that should be enough time
content.html: as long as you add write access before the CI jobs have completed, it should post the build status. it can be tricky to add it before the jobs have started but it takes a while for the jobs to finish, so that should be enough time
